lines.gurmukhi: mn miRg miRgmd ACq AMqrgiq BUilE BRm Kojq iPrq bn mwhI jI
lines.transliteration_english: Man Mrig Mrigamad Achhat Antaragati , Bhooliao Bhram Khojat Dhirat Ban Maahee Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Human mind is like a fast running deer who has Naam-like musk within him. But under various doubts and misgivings, he keeps searching it in forest.

lines.gurmukhi: dwdr sroj giq eykY srvr ibKY AMqir idsMqr huie smJY nwhI jI
lines.transliteration_english: Daadar Saroj Gati Aykai Saravar Bikhai , Antari Disantar Hui Samajhai Naahee Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Frog and lotus flower live in the same pond but despite that the frog-like mind does not know lotus as if he is residing in a foreign land. The frog eats moss and not lotus flower. Such is the state of mind who is not aware of the Naam Amrit co-existing w

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibiKAwDr qjY n ibiK ibKm kau Aihinis bwvn ibrK lptwhI jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Bikhiaadhar Tajai N Bikhi Bikham Kau , Ahinisi Baavan Birakh Lapataahee Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a snake never sheds his venom although he keeps coiled around a sandalwood tree so is the state of that person who does not shed his vices even in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy nrpiq supnMqr ByKwrI hoie gurmuiK jgq mY Brm imtwhI jI ]223]
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Narapati Soupanantar Bhaykhaaree Hoi , Gurmukhi Jagat Mai Bharam Mitaahee Jee ?223?

Shabad OS B.translation: The state of our wandering mind is like a king who becomes a beggar in his dream. But the mind of a Sikh of the Guru dispels all his doubts and misgivings with the power of Naam Simran and recognising his self, lives a purposeful, contented and a happy li
